info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Berks County through 615 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Reading, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Shillington, West Reading, Mount Penn, Mohnton, Kenhorst, St. Lawrence, Lorane, Reiffton, Flying Hills, West Lawn, West Wyomissing and Wyomissing Hills. This includes Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
